The

Lodge

Afternoon Tea 

Excellent Dining in Jesmond Dene

Welcome to Fisherman's Lodge, one of Newcastle's closely guarded secrets. For 38 years Fisherman's Lodge has been a noted restaurant in the North-East region. Most importantly you will find us welcoming and friendly, and our priority is to ensure that you have a superb evening dinner, wedding or lunch to remember.

We pride ourselves on remaining one of the North-East's most charming fine dining restaurant venues - particularly for special occasions. We have always been primarily a seafood restaurant, but we also serve a range of Modern British dishes using locally supplied organic meat and vegetables. The local beef and lamb reared in Northumbria are amongst the finest in Europe. But apart from the fresh fish and meats, we also have access to the abundance of game which the local region is famous for. We like to cater for everybody and therefore every menu we produce has a vegetarian option, and we do have a vegetarian menu if requested. We can also accommodate most special dietary requirements provided you let us know.

We don't set out to be pretentious or elevate ourselves. We do aim to provide delicious food made from the best, freshest & finest produce we can find and we are bringing back to our cuisine the emphasis on fish & game that first led to Fisherman's Lodge becoming a popular prestige venue. Accompanying this we provide a wide range of carefully chosen fine wines & spirits, as well as a renowned cheeseboard.

You will find us deep in the leafy wooded glade that is Jesmond Dene, set beside the gushing Ouseburn stream. A secluded oasis of rare trees planted by the noble Lord Armstrong some 150 years ago, but still only five minutes' drive from the throbbing heart of urban Newcastle.

We look forward to your visit in the near future.

Jamie Howell
Managing Director/Owner

You will find our sustainable seafood & fish policy on the "Restaurant" page

Fisherman's Lodge Menus

The following menus are offered as guideline to the current offering at the restaurant.  They may be subject to change either daily and the pricing may vary from time to time as well.  At the moment we have greatly reduced the prices on the menus.  This is designed to offer more reasonable terms during these austere times and encourage people to use the restaurant. 

Our current A La Carte contains main dishes that vary from around 15 up to 20 - although occasionally we will serve more expensive items such as lobster, brill, halibut, fillet steak, game, etc. which will take the price over 20.  Usually such items are seasonal.  More complex dishes using a variety of expensive ingredients may contribute to higher price for any particular dish.  Dishes using dairy products will tend to increase the price.  Cheese is particularly expensive.  Some vegetables and herbs, particularly imported or from local high quality producers that we use will also be reflected in the pricing as these products are expensive as well.

Pricing sometimes reflects the amount of work and creativity of any particular chef we employ at the time or in service any particular evening. 

NEW LUNCH MENU

We now have a new lunch menu which is designed to make the restaurant user friendly particularly to the local community and offer simpler and less expensive dishes.  The A La Carte Menu will continue to be offered at lunch.

 AFTERNOON TEA (please book for full English Afternoon Tea)

Please see the pages for Afternoon Tea -  tab can be found on the "Home" page.

We are happy to serve walk-in customers with tea or coffee and whatever is available on the days afternoon tea menu.  Prices will vary.

Fine Dining at Fisherman's Lodge

Fisherman's Lodge has been one of the North-East's premier fine dining restaurants for nearly 40 years. Set deep into the wooded glades of Jesmond Dene this wonderfully secluded venue has played host to a number of high profile customers over the years.

Using only the finest ingredients mostly from local suppliers the Fisherman's Lodge continues its tradition for Seafood & Fish but also has a focus on representing Modern British cuisine at its best. Our menu combines a vibrant mix of seafood and contemporary dishes, using only the finest British produce. Our fish and seasonal vegetables are delivered daily. Our approach is to combine the contemporary with the traditional.

The menu will always contain a seafood or fish component because of the Fisherman's Lodge provenance as a seafood restaurant.  Because many fish stocks, particularly local ones, have come close to their sustainable tolerances we are careful to balance the menus with a careful policy of producing dishes from sustainable fish or seafood types of based our own long experience & extensive knowledge - rather than celebrity chefs or greenpeace red lists. 

Because having a sustainable fish & seafood policy can be a limiting factor, our menu includes a greater amount of meat & other ingredients than it used to.  We also like to give you a chance to experience all that is to offer from local meat and vegetable suppliers. On the whole we like to arrange the menus to allow for seasonal variances.  Because fish is generally expensive please expect fish dishes to be expensive too.  You must expect to pay a dearer amount for a food source that is both in greater demand and in which stocks are depleted or dwindling.

We have tended toward relaxing our lunchtime service, with a simpler more affordable menu designed to allow for the modern pace of life. However, we still offer our A La Carte menu for those that want it.

Fisherman's Lodge is a superb place for formal or discreet informal meetings away from the city hub-bub.  We are trying encourage customers to start using the restaurant during the day and early evening on a less formal basis. Not just perceiving it as a place for a special occasion. Although we are very keen to organise any special function at the restaurant for you. We are updating the bar areas and the terrace patio area for use by those who want to enjoy a peaceful drink or beverage, perhaps accompanied by a lighter snack and in smart surroundings away from the thronging bustle of the city centre.

We will keep our fine dining in the evening with a full A La Carte Menu, but we have broadened the range of dishes and pricing to accommodate all tastes and budgets - given these austere times.

Our Sunday Lunch is designed to combine the informal family outing with all that dining in a restaurant such as Fisherman's Lodge has to offer. We always present the best in traditional British roasts, alongside several other dishes for interesting variety. 

Weekends are also popular for our special Afternoon Tea, but this is also available throughout the open hours during the week.  With the superb backdrop of Jesmond Dene, Fisherman's Lodge is a wonderful place for a delightful tasty tea time treat.

Come and enjoy a treat at Fisherman's Lodge.

FISH & SEAFOOD POLICY

We believe that most indigenous fish stocks can be better managed both in the EU & the UK by implementing both extensive no-fishing zones and seasonal fishing periods for each species according to its breeding habits (just as one would rod fishing for trout or salmon "in-season" in inland waters) We also believe in the reintroduction of nationally exclusive inshore limits even within the EU eg an 80km national limit around the UK restricted to fishing boats registered in UK ports or other EU territories except where they meet close in which case halfway with this inshore fishery exclusive to locally flagged local fishing ports. We also have believed in scrapping the quota system since rather before it came to the perception of some celebrity chefs but commend their exposure of this mad EU policy. We do believe in restriction on fishing activity. We accept seafood from sustainable & well managed fisheries such as Norway, local inshore fisheries (including Cornwall, but nearby rather more) and of course line fishing techniques.  We do serve locally pot caught lobster as long as this is not undersized, Scottish langoustine, inshore farmed mussels and oysters,  hand dived scallops or from strictly controlled beam fishing as well as hand picked shellfish or any fish from our UK inshore fisheries including shrimp and crab other than brown crab from Cornwall.  We will not serve certain types of tuna, or billfish, or threatened species or tropical or any coral fishes.  We also will not serve any fish caught by drift netting anywhere.   We will serve trout and salmon even farmed salmon as the arguments against these are highly spurious. We will serve other farmed species such as halibut, bream or John Dory.  We do serve occasional fish catches from local ranched sources such as local sea trout and properly tagged wild Tyne salmon. But we do not support illegal modern monofilament drift nets.

Fisherman's Lodge operates a save the puffin policy, particularly as puffins are indigenous to Northumbria.  Consequently, whilst we will serve anchovies from traditional Italian suppliers, we do not support the catching of local small fish, sprats or anything considered "whitebait" as the eating of these requires higher mortality rates per portion for fish that are important in the fishery food chain. We are opposed to commercial farming of small fish (particularly sand eels) for fuel or animal feed.  We are opposed generally to current EU fish management policy, and investment in Spanish fishing fleets and unsustainable Spanish fishing ports. 

We are generally opposed to commercial fishing factory ships. However, we do support local UK fishing ports and the boats serving these. We will serve local smoked or fresh herring of over 27 cms, & oversized cod, haddock, mackeral or hake. We prefer line caught fish if and when we can find it.  We will serve occasional monkfish, John Dory, Brill and Turbot - when these are readily available.

The management reserve the right to make such a policy aim - it is position of stated aims for which our chefs will try and adhere, but it cannot be used in argument by customers over particular menus or servings & we reserve the right change our seafood & fish policy for our menu at any point in time.

The Wine Cellar

Fisherman's Lodge has always prided itself on holding a good stock of fine wines, and maintaining an extensive wine list. We try to manage the cellar so as to be able to offer our customers good value but also choice - whether it be the casual enthusiast or the connoisseur. To this end we are advised by our expert wine merchants, with whom we have arranged exclusive terms.

In recent years we have been building up a reserve of very fine wine vintages, mostly traditional labels. Recently, we have taken steps to reduce the mark up on the more expensive wines with the aim of making these wines (particularly the mid-range vintages) more available. We are very keen that our customers should be able to experience quality wines, and some of our staff are trained to offer the best advice for the occasion or to pair with particular menu choices.

Fisherman's Lodge has always had a predilection towards the modern and New World - popular wines amongst the local customers. We are not afraid to try something new once we have ascertained its quality. Many of the wines we stock have won awards. Some wines we are now bringing to the table include those from up and coming wine growing areas - such as Sicily, Sardinia and parts of Spain. We hope to get our customers to appreciate well made wines, and not just the well worn label. We hope that our customers will trust our judgement and that of our expert wine merchants in trying wines that they would not normally have experienced.

In the longer term we are investing in the future. The recent quality vintage years bode well for wines that we can buy now with a view to offering them to customers in years to come, and at reasonable prices.

We are also planning to build a relationship with our customers through wine, and will be conducting regular tasting evenings with the experts, as well as developing a wine club. Every month we shall also be promoting a particular wine grape varietal, included with our wine selections on the wine list. The aim of this is to increase the experience and interest of the customer.

Our house wines have been carefully chosen to provide quality within certain price parameters. We like to offer a choice of wine types as "house wines" and usually we will have at least four to five different types of wine in each category (red, white or rose) to allow for greater choice. We have both red and white wines made by Mouton Rothschild in Chile as our stable choices for house wine, and then these are supported by different grape types from other wine growing areas.

Private Functions

Fisherman's Lodge has long had a fine reputation in private functions and is one of the most popular and unique venues in the North East. Whether you're looking to host an intimate private dinner or a large cocktail party we have a variety of function rooms available.

All private parties and functions are custom tailored to suit your needs. Our room hire rates include your own personal event manager will work with you to create the perfect bespoke event. From your initial consultation right up to the moment you and your guests leave we will ensure you host a well orchestrated event.

During your consultation we will establish your needs and requirements. We will help you decide your event format and discuss your menu and wine selections. In addition we can source a wide variety of props and decorative items to make your event special & unique.

To discuss private parties at Fisherman's Lodge contact our events team by calling 0191 281 3281.

Business at Fisherman's Lodge

The Fisherman's Lodge has always been a popular choice for Business Meetings. Just outside Newcastle City Centre set within the heart of Jesmond Dene Fisherman's Lodge provides a unique but central meeting venue. With two well-appointed function rooms available, The Lodge can be used for business presentations, meetings or a private business lunch.

Over the years Fisherman's Lodge has been the choice for business meetings or conferences for some considerable amount of both local, national and international companies.  Many of the first Sage plc board meetings were held here, and some of the initial meetings bringing Nissan to the North-East culminated at Fisherman's Lodge.  In the past year we have entertained Nestle (Switzerland head office), KLM (Amsterdam head office),  Pfizer (local representatives), Accenture, Northern Rock and many others.  Fisherman's Lodge has been the only choice for businessmen from as far away as Norway, Finland, Sweden, Holland,  Germany, Italy, France, United States of America & The Russian Federation.

Many local businesses prefer to hold board meetings or AGM's at Fisherman's Lodge because of its seclusion and privacy (apart from good car parking facilities) as well as being provided with excellent service & cuisine.

Our "day delegate" rate includes room hire, coffee & tea on arrival and full 3 course lunch is  currently available at a very reasonable 38 per person  - there is a small room hire surcharge for meetings of less than 8 persons. Alternatively if you just require room hire for a short period of time, our small boardroom is available for 80 per hour and 120 per hour for The Armstrong Suite.

If you prefer to create your own bespoke business event you can choose from our wide range of catering options.

To discuss business events at Fisherman's Lodge please call our events team on 0191 281 3281.

Weddings at Fisherman's Lodge

Nestled in the beautiful woodland of Jesmond Dene sitting at the end of a long and secluded drive, Fisherman's Lodge is a picturesque setting for the perfect wedding. Whether you're looking for an intimate wedding or exclusive venue hire we have plenty of options to choose from.

Given its unique and charming setting Fisherman's Lodge has long been a popular venue for weddings and has played host to many famous nuptial occasions. Fisherman's Lodge is licensed for Civil Ceremony Weddings and Civil Partnerships.

We have a choice of either private rooms or the main dining room which can accommodate up to 60 guests seated. We can also entertain upto 140 for a less formal buffet style meal using the whole property. Alternatively for larger parties you may wish to take advantage of Jesmond Dene's tranquil surroundings and hold your ceremony in a marquee.

If you would like to discuss weddings at Fisherman's Lodge please contact our events team to find out how we can tailor your special day on 0191 281 3281 or email: weddings@fishermanslodge.co.uk

For a printable pdf "Wedding Fact Sheet" with current pricing guide please click though the <<Wedding Planner>> link to the "Fact Sheet" tab.

Events at     "The Lodge"

   

  

 

Events & Offers

LIVINGSOCIAL AFTERNOON TEA OFFER

We are currently offering an afternoon tea offer via www.livingsocial.com which comprise our normal afternoon tea menu at 14 for two persons (22 per person including a glass of champagne.)  THE OFFER HAS NOW CLOSED HAVING BEEN FULLY SUBSCRIBED.

I You Have Purchased a LivingSocial Voucher

PLEASE DO NOT BOOK ONLINE but call the restaurant on 0191 281 3281 to make your booking. 

Have your voucher number ready when you book. We will also need a telephone number, and an email address if you have one.

The voucher is now valid for 12 months (you can book at any time during our normal afternoon tea opening hours.)

Be aware that we are not always open on Mondays or Tuesdays, and we also reserve the right to refuse your booking if we are full or the restaurant is being used for some other purpose.

  • For History

    in the Dene


    Fisherman's Lodge is the perfect venue for your
    private business meeting or lunch

    		  

The Lodge

The site which Fisherman's Lodge occupies has always held some historic connections, many of which stem from the Ouseburn stream which carved out the gorge that is now Jesmond Dene. For several centuries it was the site of a corn mill known as Heaton Cottages, and converted to the grinding of powdered flint by John Charlton in 1857. The flint being used as glaze in the potteries situated at the mouth of the Ouseburn.

In 1860 Lord Armstrong hired the services of Capt. Andrew Noble (Royal Artillery) as factory manager at his Elswick Armaments business. A house was built for Capt. Noble and his family called Deep Dene House, and now the same building that is occupied by Fisherman's Lodge. Capt. Noble occupied the house until 1871, when he moved to nearby Jesmond Dene House.

Deep Dene House, first became a restaurant and tea rooms in 1900. For some time up to WW2 the house and grounds were used as tea rooms to entertain visitors enjoying the delights of Jesmond Dene. After a wartime interlude in which the house was used as a military hospice, and for a short period as a private home.

Franco Cetoloni first established a fine dining restaurant which he named Fisherman's Lodge in 1973, as sister restaurant to his successful establishment on the Quayside called Fisherman's Lodge. Both were recognised seafood restaurants of some repute, and Fisherman's Lodge gained in recognition from the expert abilities of Terry Laybourne in the kitchen - and who went on to set up his own award winning restaurants in the city and in Durham. Fisherman's Lodge soon became one of the premier restaurants in the North-East, a fact which was extended by acquisition by Tom Maxfield's Tom's Companies Ltd early in 2000 in a portfolio that also included Seaham Hall (1 Michelin Star at the time) and famous The Samling Hotel in the Lake District near Windemere. The present owner purchased the restaurant from Tom's Companies in September 2009.

Jesmond Dene, the park in which Fisherman's Lodge is located was a park created by engineer and philanthropist, William Armstrong 1810 - 1900 (1st Baron Armstrong.) The park was creatively landscaped by Armstrong and his wife, with modifications to the river, a small zoo (Pet's Corner) and some tremendous trees of which there are well over 100 varieties. The resulted is an exceptional enchanted hidden valley, deep within the city of Newcastle and protected by Lord Armstrong's bequest of 1883 to the City of Newcastle.

Features worth noting and seeing in Jesmond Dene include: The Old Mill first recorded in 1271; The ruined Banqueting Hall built by Lord Armstrong to entertain princes and heads of state; The Armstrong Bridge, and iron bridge built by Lord Armstrong in 1878 and presently the site of a Sunday market; The Stepping-Stones erected by Lady Armstrong in 1889 and part of the man-made features of the Ouseburn stream that runs along the course of the Dene. The various bridges and waterfalls along the Red Walk which lead to and from Fisherman's Lodge for over half a mile in either direction add to the enchanted atmosphere , surrounded as they are by the 200ft tree lined gorge that comprises the 3 mile long Jesmond Dene. At the South entrance the new Millfield House Visitor Centre and Pet's Corner (a small zoo) provide additional attractions for children, as well as other nearby features including Cherry Walk, and St. Mary's Chapel (the ruins of one of Newcastle's earliest churches.)

Jesmond Dene is also home to one of the world's only surviving real tennis & racquets courts built by Capt. Noble in 1894. It is presently occupied by the Jesmond Dene Real Tennis Club, through which access can be arranged, and is only minutes away from Fisherman's Lodge.

History & Amenity Links
William Armstrong www.williamarmstrong.info/jesmond-dene-visitor-centre
Jesmond Dene Visitor Centre www.jesmonddene.org.uk/?p=83
Jesmond Dene Real Tennis Club www.jdrtc.co.uk/index.htm

Afternoon Tea at the Lodge

Enjoying Afternoon Tea at the Lodge is a wonderful way to spend an afternoon in the midst of Jesmond Dene, far away from the bustle and turmoil of busy city life.  All the afternoon fayre is home baked or prepared in the kitchen each day.  It could not be fresher and is made from quality food materials. 

We offer delicious tea from local tea merchant, Rington, whose range of blends is unsurpassed.  Our coffee is made-up & supplied by another local firm, Ouseburn Coffee Co. comprising some unique blends from Brazil and other Latin American producers.  Either that or enjoy a pot of steaming hot Green & Blacks Organic Fair Trade Chocolate with whipped cream. 

 

Our popularly acclaimed Classic Afternoon Tea - with choices of Ringtons tea or coffee or hot chocolate by the pot.  15 per person or 25 per person including glass of House Champagne.  The tea is designed to be entirely traditional, yet simple, and is based on a conventional afternoon tea menu from a well known London Mayfair hotel in the 1920's. 

Menu

Classic Afternoon Tea                                                   15 per person

Champagne Tea                                                           25 per person

Cream Tea                                                                      9 per person

The

Lodge

Afternoon Tea  


Excellent Dining in Jesmond Dene

Welcome to Fisherman's Lodge, one of Newcastle's closely guarded secrets. For 38 years Fisherman's Lodge has been a noted restaurant in the North-East region. Most importantly you will find us welcoming and friendly, and our priority is to ensure that you have a superb evening dinner, wedding or lunch to remember.

We pride ourselves on remaining one of the North-East's most charming fine dining restaurant venues - particularly for special occasions. We have always been primarily a seafood restaurant, but we also serve a range of Modern British dishes using locally supplied organic meat and vegetables. The local beef and lamb reared in Northumbria are amongst the finest in Europe. But apart from the fresh fish and meats, we also have access to the abundance of game which the local region is famous for. We like to cater for everybody and therefore every menu we produce has a vegetarian option, and we do have a vegetarian menu if requested. We can also accommodate most special dietary requirements provided you let us know.

We don't set out to be pretentious or elevate ourselves. We do aim to provide delicious food made from the best, freshest & finest produce we can find and we are bringing back to our cuisine the emphasis on fish & game that first led to Fisherman's Lodge becoming a popular prestige venue. Accompanying this we provide a wide range of carefully chosen fine wines & spirits, as well as a renowned cheeseboard.

You will find us deep in the leafy wooded glade that is Jesmond Dene, set beside the gushing Ouseburn stream. A secluded oasis of rare trees planted by the noble Lord Armstrong some 150 years ago, but still only five minutes' drive from the throbbing heart of urban Newcastle.

We look forward to your visit in the near future.

Jamie Howell
Managing Director/Owner

You will find our sustainable seafood & fish policy on the "Restaurant" page

Fisherman's Lodge Menus

The following menus are offered as guideline to the current offering at the restaurant.  They may be subject to change either daily and the pricing may vary from time to time as well.  At the moment we have greatly reduced the prices on the menus.  This is designed to offer more reasonable terms during these austere times and encourage people to use the restaurant. 

Our current A La Carte contains main dishes that vary from around £15 up to £20 - although occasionally we will serve more expensive items such as lobster, brill, halibut, fillet steak, game, etc. which will take the price over £20.  Usually such items are seasonal.  More complex dishes using a variety of expensive ingredients may contribute to higher price for any particular dish.  Dishes using dairy products will tend to increase the price.  Cheese is particularly expensive.  Some vegetables and herbs, particularly imported or from local high quality producers that we use will also be reflected in the pricing as these products are expensive as well.

Pricing sometimes reflects the amount of work and creativity of any particular chef we employ at the time or in service any particular evening. 

NEW LUNCH MENU

We now have a new lunch menu which is designed to make the restaurant user friendly particularly to the local community and offer simpler and less expensive dishes.  The A La Carte Menu will continue to be offered at lunch.

 AFTERNOON TEA (please book for full English Afternoon Tea)

Please see the pages for Afternoon Tea -  tab can be found on the "Home" page.

We are happy to serve walk-in customers with tea or coffee and whatever is available on the days afternoon tea menu.  Prices will vary.

Fine Dining at Fisherman's Lodge

Fisherman's Lodge has been one of the North-East's premier fine dining restaurants for nearly 40 years. Set deep into the wooded glades of Jesmond Dene this wonderfully secluded venue has played host to a number of high profile customers over the years.

Using only the finest ingredients mostly from local suppliers the Fisherman's Lodge continues its tradition for Seafood & Fish but also has a focus on representing Modern British cuisine at its best. Our menu combines a vibrant mix of seafood and contemporary dishes, using only the finest British produce. Our fish and seasonal vegetables are delivered daily. Our approach is to combine the contemporary with the traditional.

The menu will always contain a seafood or fish component because of the Fisherman's Lodge provenance as a seafood restaurant.  Because many fish stocks, particularly local ones, have come close to their sustainable tolerances we are careful to balance the menus with a careful policy of producing dishes from sustainable fish or seafood types of based our own long experience & extensive knowledge - rather than celebrity chefs or greenpeace red lists. 

Because having a sustainable fish & seafood policy can be a limiting factor, our menu includes a greater amount of meat & other ingredients than it used to.  We also like to give you a chance to experience all that is to offer from local meat and vegetable suppliers. On the whole we like to arrange the menus to allow for seasonal variances.  Because fish is generally expensive please expect fish dishes to be expensive too.  You must expect to pay a dearer amount for a food source that is both in greater demand and in which stocks are depleted or dwindling.

We have tended toward relaxing our lunchtime service, with a simpler more affordable menu designed to allow for the modern pace of life. However, we still offer our A La Carte menu for those that want it.

Fisherman's Lodge is a superb place for formal or discreet informal meetings away from the city hub-bub.  We are trying encourage customers to start using the restaurant during the day and early evening on a less formal basis. Not just perceiving it as a place for a special occasion. Although we are very keen to organise any special function at the restaurant for you. We are updating the bar areas and the terrace patio area for use by those who want to enjoy a peaceful drink or beverage, perhaps accompanied by a lighter snack and in smart surroundings away from the thronging bustle of the city centre.

We will keep our fine dining in the evening with a full A La Carte Menu, but we have broadened the range of dishes and pricing to accommodate all tastes and budgets - given these austere times.

Our Sunday Lunch is designed to combine the informal family outing with all that dining in a restaurant such as Fisherman's Lodge has to offer. We always present the best in traditional British roasts, alongside several other dishes for interesting variety. 

Weekends are also popular for our special Afternoon Tea, but this is also available throughout the open hours during the week.  With the superb backdrop of Jesmond Dene, Fisherman's Lodge is a wonderful place for a delightful tasty tea time treat.

Come and enjoy a treat at Fisherman's Lodge.

FISH & SEAFOOD POLICY

We believe that most indigenous fish stocks can be better managed both in the EU & the UK by implementing both extensive no-fishing zones and seasonal fishing periods for each species according to its breeding habits (just as one would rod fishing for trout or salmon "in-season" in inland waters) We also believe in the reintroduction of nationally exclusive inshore limits even within the EU eg an 80km national limit around the UK restricted to fishing boats registered in UK ports or other EU territories except where they meet close in which case halfway with this inshore fishery exclusive to locally flagged local fishing ports. We also have believed in scrapping the quota system since rather before it came to the perception of some celebrity chefs but commend their exposure of this mad EU policy. We do believe in restriction on fishing activity. We accept seafood from sustainable & well managed fisheries such as Norway, local inshore fisheries (including Cornwall, but nearby rather more) and of course line fishing techniques.  We do serve locally pot caught lobster as long as this is not undersized, Scottish langoustine, inshore farmed mussels and oysters,  hand dived scallops or from strictly controlled beam fishing as well as hand picked shellfish or any fish from our UK inshore fisheries including shrimp and crab other than brown crab from Cornwall.  We will not serve certain types of tuna, or billfish, or threatened species or tropical or any coral fishes.  We also will not serve any fish caught by drift netting anywhere.   We will serve trout and salmon even farmed salmon as the arguments against these are highly spurious. We will serve other farmed species such as halibut, bream or John Dory.  We do serve occasional fish catches from local ranched sources such as local sea trout and properly tagged wild Tyne salmon. But we do not support illegal modern monofilament drift nets.

Fisherman's Lodge operates a save the puffin policy, particularly as puffins are indigenous to Northumbria.  Consequently, whilst we will serve anchovies from traditional Italian suppliers, we do not support the catching of local small fish, sprats or anything considered "whitebait" as the eating of these requires higher mortality rates per portion for fish that are important in the fishery food chain. We are opposed to commercial farming of small fish (particularly sand eels) for fuel or animal feed.  We are opposed generally to current EU fish management policy, and investment in Spanish fishing fleets and unsustainable Spanish fishing ports. 

We are generally opposed to commercial fishing factory ships. However, we do support local UK fishing ports and the boats serving these. We will serve local smoked or fresh herring of over 27 cms, & oversized cod, haddock, mackeral or hake. We prefer line caught fish if and when we can find it.  We will serve occasional monkfish, John Dory, Brill and Turbot - when these are readily available.

The management reserve the right to make such a policy aim - it is position of stated aims for which our chefs will try and adhere, but it cannot be used in argument by customers over particular menus or servings & we reserve the right change our seafood & fish policy for our menu at any point in time.

The Wine Cellar

Fisherman's Lodge has always prided itself on holding a good stock of fine wines, and maintaining an extensive wine list. We try to manage the cellar so as to be able to offer our customers good value but also choice - whether it be the casual enthusiast or the connoisseur. To this end we are advised by our expert wine merchants, with whom we have arranged exclusive terms.

In recent years we have been building up a reserve of very fine wine vintages, mostly traditional labels. Recently, we have taken steps to reduce the mark up on the more expensive wines with the aim of making these wines (particularly the mid-range vintages) more available. We are very keen that our customers should be able to experience quality wines, and some of our staff are trained to offer the best advice for the occasion or to pair with particular menu choices.

Fisherman's Lodge has always had a predilection towards the modern and New World - popular wines amongst the local customers. We are not afraid to try something new once we have ascertained its quality. Many of the wines we stock have won awards. Some wines we are now bringing to the table include those from up and coming wine growing areas - such as Sicily, Sardinia and parts of Spain. We hope to get our customers to appreciate well made wines, and not just the well worn label. We hope that our customers will trust our judgement and that of our expert wine merchants in trying wines that they would not normally have experienced.

In the longer term we are investing in the future. The recent quality vintage years bode well for wines that we can buy now with a view to offering them to customers in years to come, and at reasonable prices.

We are also planning to build a relationship with our customers through wine, and will be conducting regular tasting evenings with the experts, as well as developing a wine club. Every month we shall also be promoting a particular wine grape varietal, included with our wine selections on the wine list. The aim of this is to increase the experience and interest of the customer.

Our house wines have been carefully chosen to provide quality within certain price parameters. We like to offer a choice of wine types as "house wines" and usually we will have at least four to five different types of wine in each category (red, white or rose) to allow for greater choice. We have both red and white wines made by Mouton Rothschild in Chile as our stable choices for house wine, and then these are supported by different grape types from other wine growing areas.

Private Functions

Fisherman's Lodge has long had a fine reputation in private functions and is one of the most popular and unique venues in the North East. Whether you're looking to host an intimate private dinner or a large cocktail party we have a variety of function rooms available.

All private parties and functions are custom tailored to suit your needs. Our room hire rates include your own personal event manager will work with you to create the perfect bespoke event. From your initial consultation right up to the moment you and your guests leave we will ensure you host a well orchestrated event.

During your consultation we will establish your needs and requirements. We will help you decide your event format and discuss your menu and wine selections. In addition we can source a wide variety of props and decorative items to make your event special & unique.

To discuss private parties at Fisherman's Lodge contact our events team by calling 0191 281 3281.

Business at Fisherman's Lodge

The Fisherman's Lodge has always been a popular choice for Business Meetings. Just outside Newcastle City Centre set within the heart of Jesmond Dene Fisherman's Lodge provides a unique but central meeting venue. With two well-appointed function rooms available, The Lodge can be used for business presentations, meetings or a private business lunch.

Over the years Fisherman's Lodge has been the choice for business meetings or conferences for some considerable amount of both local, national and international companies.  Many of the first Sage plc board meetings were held here, and some of the initial meetings bringing Nissan to the North-East culminated at Fisherman's Lodge.  In the past year we have entertained Nestle (Switzerland head office), KLM (Amsterdam head office),  Pfizer (local representatives), Accenture, Northern Rock and many others.  Fisherman's Lodge has been the only choice for businessmen from as far away as Norway, Finland, Sweden, Holland,  Germany, Italy, France, United States of America & The Russian Federation.

Many local businesses prefer to hold board meetings or AGM's at Fisherman's Lodge because of its seclusion and privacy (apart from good car parking facilities) as well as being provided with excellent service & cuisine.

Our "day delegate" rate includes room hire, coffee & tea on arrival and full 3 course lunch is  currently available at a very reasonable £38 per person  - there is a small room hire surcharge for meetings of less than 8 persons. Alternatively if you just require room hire for a short period of time, our small boardroom is available for £80 per hour and £120 per hour for The Armstrong Suite.

If you prefer to create your own bespoke business event you can choose from our wide range of catering options.

To discuss business events at Fisherman's Lodge please call our events team on 0191 281 3281.

Weddings at Fisherman's Lodge

Nestled in the beautiful woodland of Jesmond Dene sitting at the end of a long and secluded drive, Fisherman's Lodge is a picturesque setting for the perfect wedding. Whether you're looking for an intimate wedding or exclusive venue hire we have plenty of options to choose from.

Given its unique and charming setting Fisherman's Lodge has long been a popular venue for weddings and has played host to many famous nuptial occasions. Fisherman's Lodge is licensed for Civil Ceremony Weddings and Civil Partnerships.

We have a choice of either private rooms or the main dining room which can accommodate up to 60 guests seated. We can also entertain upto 140 for a less formal buffet style meal using the whole property. Alternatively for larger parties you may wish to take advantage of Jesmond Dene's tranquil surroundings and hold your ceremony in a marquee.

If you would like to discuss weddings at Fisherman's Lodge please contact our events team to find out how we can tailor your special day on 0191 281 3281 or email: weddings@fishermanslodge.co.uk

For a printable pdf "Wedding Fact Sheet" with current pricing guide please click though the <<Wedding Planner>> link to the "Fact Sheet" tab.

  • For History

    in the Dene


    Fisherman's Lodge is the perfect venue for your
    private business meeting or lunch

    		  

The Lodge

The site which Fisherman's Lodge occupies has always held some historic connections, many of which stem from the Ouseburn stream which carved out the gorge that is now Jesmond Dene. For several centuries it was the site of a corn mill known as Heaton Cottages, and converted to the grinding of powdered flint by John Charlton in 1857. The flint being used as glaze in the potteries situated at the mouth of the Ouseburn.

In 1860 Lord Armstrong hired the services of Capt. Andrew Noble (Royal Artillery) as factory manager at his Elswick Armaments business. A house was built for Capt. Noble and his family called Deep Dene House, and now the same building that is occupied by Fisherman's Lodge. Capt. Noble occupied the house until 1871, when he moved to nearby Jesmond Dene House.

Deep Dene House, first became a restaurant and tea rooms in 1900. For some time up to WW2 the house and grounds were used as tea rooms to entertain visitors enjoying the delights of Jesmond Dene. After a wartime interlude in which the house was used as a military hospice, and for a short period as a private home.

Franco Cetoloni first established a fine dining restaurant which he named Fisherman's Lodge in 1973, as sister restaurant to his successful establishment on the Quayside called Fisherman's Lodge. Both were recognised seafood restaurants of some repute, and Fisherman's Lodge gained in recognition from the expert abilities of Terry Laybourne in the kitchen - and who went on to set up his own award winning restaurants in the city and in Durham. Fisherman's Lodge soon became one of the premier restaurants in the North-East, a fact which was extended by acquisition by Tom Maxfield's Tom's Companies Ltd early in 2000 in a portfolio that also included Seaham Hall (1 Michelin Star at the time) and famous The Samling Hotel in the Lake District near Windemere. The present owner purchased the restaurant from Tom's Companies in September 2009.

Jesmond Dene, the park in which Fisherman's Lodge is located was a park created by engineer and philanthropist, William Armstrong 1810 - 1900 (1st Baron Armstrong.) The park was creatively landscaped by Armstrong and his wife, with modifications to the river, a small zoo (Pet's Corner) and some tremendous trees of which there are well over 100 varieties. The resulted is an exceptional enchanted hidden valley, deep within the city of Newcastle and protected by Lord Armstrong's bequest of 1883 to the City of Newcastle.

Features worth noting and seeing in Jesmond Dene include: The Old Mill first recorded in 1271; The ruined Banqueting Hall built by Lord Armstrong to entertain princes and heads of state; The Armstrong Bridge, and iron bridge built by Lord Armstrong in 1878 and presently the site of a Sunday market; The Stepping-Stones erected by Lady Armstrong in 1889 and part of the man-made features of the Ouseburn stream that runs along the course of the Dene. The various bridges and waterfalls along the Red Walk which lead to and from Fisherman's Lodge for over half a mile in either direction add to the enchanted atmosphere , surrounded as they are by the 200ft tree lined gorge that comprises the 3 mile long Jesmond Dene. At the South entrance the new Millfield House Visitor Centre and Pet's Corner (a small zoo) provide additional attractions for children, as well as other nearby features including Cherry Walk, and St. Mary's Chapel (the ruins of one of Newcastle's earliest churches.)

Jesmond Dene is also home to one of the world's only surviving real tennis & racquets courts built by Capt. Noble in 1894. It is presently occupied by the Jesmond Dene Real Tennis Club, through which access can be arranged, and is only minutes away from Fisherman's Lodge.

History & Amenity Links
William Armstrong www.williamarmstrong.info/jesmond-dene-visitor-centre
Jesmond Dene Visitor Centre www.jesmonddene.org.uk/?p=83
Jesmond Dene Real Tennis Club www.jdrtc.co.uk/index.htm

Afternoon Tea at the Lodge

Enjoying Afternoon Tea at the Lodge is a wonderful way to spend an afternoon in the midst of Jesmond Dene, far away from the bustle and turmoil of busy city life.  All the afternoon fayre is home baked or prepared in the kitchen each day.  It could not be fresher and is made from quality food materials. 

We offer delicious tea from local tea merchant, Rington, whose range of blends is unsurpassed.  Our coffee is made-up & supplied by another local firm, Ouseburn Coffee Co. comprising some unique blends from Brazil and other Latin American producers.  Either that or enjoy a pot of steaming hot Green & Blacks Organic Fair Trade Chocolate with whipped cream. 

 

Our popularly acclaimed Classic Afternoon Tea - with choices of Ringtons tea or coffee or hot chocolate by the pot.  £15 per person or £25 per person including glass of House Champagne.  The tea is designed to be entirely traditional, yet simple, and is based on a conventional afternoon tea menu from a well known London Mayfair hotel in the 1920's. 

Menu

Classic Afternoon Tea                                                   £15 per person

Champagne Tea                                                           £25 per person

Cream Tea                                                                      £9 per person

Round of Finger Sandwiches                                          £6.80  

Small Pot of Tea, Coffee or Hot Chocolate                     £4.00 (serves one person)

Large Pot of Tea, Coffee or Hot Chocolate                    £6.00 (serves two persons)

1ltr Jug of Homemade Lemonade                                   £6.00

Glass of Homemade Lemonade or Fruit Juice                £3.00
